macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Edge Higher in Wobbly Start to 2026 Trading
items.summary: The Dow rose 0.7% to 48,382, S&P 500 gained 0.2% to 6,858, while Nasdaq dipped slightly amid thin holiday trading. Tech stocks like Nvidia led gains, but Microsoft and Tesla weighed on the market after Tesla's sales decline.

items.title: AI Sector Sparks New Year's Rally After Market Slump
items.summary: Major indexes rose on the first trading day of 2026, driven by AI and chip stocks like Baidu's AI unit IPO filing and Nvidia's 1.3% gain, snapping a four-day losing streak from late 2025.

items.title: Fed Faces Tightrope on Inflation and Labor Data in 2026 Outlook
items.summary: Markets anticipate Fed easing to 3% rates by year-end amid 2.40% core PCE inflation and 4.4% unemployment, with policy hinging on labor market trajectory and Q1 data.

items.title: S&P 500 January Barometer Signals Key Test for 2026 Markets
items.summary: Investors eye the January Barometer, historically accurate over 80% since 1950, as S&P 500's early performance could predict full-year direction amid AI optimism and sector rotation.

items.title: Global Markets Quiet on Holiday with No Major Data Releases
items.summary: US and European markets closed January 4; low activity as investors assess 2025 results and await Fed/ECB signals, China data, and first full trading week.

items.title: Tesla Reports Falling Sales for Second Year, Drags on Nasdaq
items.summary: Tesla shares dropped 2.6% after announcing declining sales for the second consecutive year, contributing to Nasdaq's flat performance amid broader tech volatility.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto Market Slides with Sharp BTC and ETH Sell-Off Amid Regulatory Focus
items.summary: The total crypto market cap stands at $3.11T with trading volume at $70.49B, as Bitcoin and Ethereum face sharp sell-offs; Fear and Greed Index is neutral at 38. No major token unlocks scheduled, but macroeconomic data like US labor and inflation reports are key watches.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Hits $3T, Bitcoin Near Historical Highs Despite Recent Slide
items.summary: Market capitalization hovers around $3 trillion, down from 2025 peak of $4T, with Bitcoin trading near highs and altcoins recovering; institutional investments and macroeconomic improvements drive cautious optimism.

items.title: China Launches Incentives for Digital Yuan to Accelerate De-Dollarization
items.summary: China introduces e-CNY incentives starting January 1, 2026, targeting BRICS de-dollarization, potentially shifting global settlements and impacting stablecoin demand in cross-border crypto transactions.

items.title: Institutional Bitcoin 'Super Cycle' Driven by Trump Policies and US Strategic Reserve
items.summary: Bitcoin enters 2026 super cycle fueled by institutional inflows, Trump-era liquidity, U.S. Strategic Bitcoin Reserve via Executive Order 14025, and $103B in ETF/ETP allocations; Fed rate cuts to sub-3% expected.

items.title: DeFi TVL Surpasses $160B with Ethereum L2 and Solana Advancements
items.summary: DeFi sector grows over 40% in 2025 to $160B+ TVL, boosted by Ethereum layer-2 solutions like zk-rollups and Solana's high-speed reliability; AI integration enhances trading and security.

items.title: Virtuals Protocol and Stacks Lead Altcoin Gains Amid Market Slide
items.summary: Virtuals Protocol (VIRTUAL) surges 15% with $235M volume on AI agent momentum; Stacks (STX) rises 14% to $0.30 on technical breakout, highlighting altcoin resilience.

items.title: Ethereum and Solana Positioned for 2026 DeFi Reboot
items.summary: Ethereum and Solana advancements in layer-2 and high-throughput set the stage for a DeFi resurgence in 2026, building on recent technical improvements.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: UCLA Researchers Introduce Model-Free Training for Optical AI Using Reinforcement Learning
items.summary: Scientists at UCLA have developed a reinforcement learning framework using proximal policy optimization (PPO) for in situ training of diffractive optical processors, enabling direct learning from real optical measurements without digital twins or physical models. The approach demonstrates applications in image classification, hologram generation, and aberration correction, advancing intelligent physical AI systems.

items.title: BBC AI Decoded Discusses World Models for Embodied AI and AGI Progress at Google DeepMind
items.summary: BBC's AI Decoded features expert Connor Leahy and DeepMind researchers highlighting interactive world models as critical for embodied AI in robots and self-driving cars, enabling synthetic training environments to accelerate development toward AGI. The segment also touches on AI safety concerns and recent reports of pioneer Yoshua Bengio's worries about existential risks.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Apple Teases iPhone 17 Under-Display Cameras and Watch Series 11 Health Upgrades
items.summary: Apple revealed updates for the iPhone 17 including under-display cameras, alongside new health sensors for Watch Series 11 and improved noise-cancellation in AirPods Pro 3.

items.title: Elon Musk Announces Neuralink Mass Production of Brain Implants by Mid-2026
items.summary: Neuralink plans to begin mass production of brain implants targeting paralysis patients first, with rollout expected by mid-2026.

items.title: Israel's Iron Beam Laser Defense System Goes Live
items.summary: Israel activated its U.S.-backed Iron Beam laser system, capable of intercepting drones with directed-energy technology.

items.title: Jio and Airtel Achieve 90% Nationwide 5G Coverage in India
items.summary: Indian telecom giants Jio and Airtel expanded 5G networks to cover 90% of the country.

items.title: SpaceX Plans Deorbit of Older Starlink Satellites for Orbital Efficiency
items.summary: SpaceX announced intentions to deorbit older Starlink satellites to improve orbit cleanliness and spectrum efficiency.

items.title: Nvidia CES Keynote Preview Highlights Physical AI and Robotics Push
items.summary: Ahead of CES on January 5, Nvidia's Jensen Huang keynote is expected to focus on physical AI including robots and self-driving cars.

items.title: Trump Mobile Delays First Smartphone Launch Due to Government Shutdown
items.summary: Trump Mobile's debut smartphone has been postponed, citing impacts from the government shutdown.
